sentences.en: ...the so-called unbridgeable gap between the world of humans and that of chimpanzees.
sentences.cn: ...人类社会和黑猩猩社会间所谓的不可逾越的鸿沟。

sentences.en: He believed there was an unbridgeable gulf between him and his parents.
sentences.cn: 他认为自己与父母之间有不可逾越的鸿沟.

sentences.en: That one splIt'second of proximity seems instead like an unbridgeable gap.
sentences.cn: 这一刹那的撙近,反见得暌隔的渺茫.

sentences.en: The gap between the President and his opponents is unbridgeable.
sentences.cn: 总统和反对派之间的嫌隙是不可弥合的。

sentences.en: The similarity in psychological makeup was just enough to make the ultimate differences unbridgeable.
sentences.cn: 心理特征方面的相似之处,足以使根本分歧难以弥合.

trans.tran_cn: 不能架桥的，不能逾越的
trans.tran_en: An unbridgeable gap or divide between two sides in an argument is so great that the two sides seem unlikely ever to agree
